item.title: Perl needs modern garbage collection
item.description: Chromatic just wrote a list of important features that Perl 5 needs. While I agree with most of the listed ones (and in fact contributed to the new p5-mop proposal during the recent Hackathon), I found one feature curiously missing. I mean, JWZ pointed this out in 1998; Perl garbage collection is a bad joke. That was 14 years ago, and the situation is the same. It is trivial to create a circular reference and trip it up.
